title: Dominican Americans
summary: Dominican Americans (Spanish: dom√≠nico-americanos,[2] estadounidenses dominicanos) are Americans who trace their ancestry to the Dominican Republic. The word may refer to someone born in the United States of Dominican descent or to someone who has migrated to the United States from the Dominican Republic. As of 2018, there were approximately 2.08 million people of Dominican descent in the United States, including both native and foreign-born.[1] Dominican Americans are the fifth-largest Latin American group in the United States, after Mexicans, Puerto Ricans, Salvadorans and Cubans.
